metro

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds all necessary information that are stored in the settings.cfg file. This class can also load and parse this file by calling read(). By calling set(String, Object), the settings will automagically saved into the settings.cfg, so no manual call is necessary. This class differs between _settings and _newSettings. The _newSettings field holds all settings including the changed ones whereas _settings holds only the old ones. To get the old settings just call getOld(String) and to get the new ones call get(String).
    Author:
    hauke

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Settings getInstance()
        Returns:
        The instance of the settings. There can only be one instance per game.

      • create

        public void create()
        Creates a plain default config file for this system with quite low settings.

      • read

        public void read()
        Reads everything from the settings.cfg.

      • getNextEntry

        private java.lang.String getNextEntry(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
        Returns the next entry in the settings file.
        Parameters:
        reader - The reader of the file.
        Returns:
        The next entry of the file.

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves everything to the settings file. A flag is set, when something changed, so there won't be unnecessary writing.

      • getOld

        public java.lang.Object getOld(java.lang.String settingsKey)
        Returns the original value (the value after starting the game with no changes) of the settings.
        Parameters:
        settingsKey - The key which value you want to have.
        Returns:
        The value of the key. "" when key does not exist.

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String settingsKey)
        Returns the value of the given setting.
        Parameters:
        settingsKey - The key which value you want to have.
        Returns:
        The value of the key. "" when key does not exist.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String key,
       java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a setting to the given value. This method will automagically save the settings, you don't have to call save() manually.
        Parameters:
        key - The the key of the setting.
        value - The new value of the setting.
